name: Titanium.WatchSession
summary: Used to enable data and file transfers between a watchOS and iOS application.

events.name: receivemessage
events.summary: App received message from apple watch in foreground. Will be called on startup if the incoming message caused the receiver to launch.

properties.name: message
properties.summary: The message content

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

events.name: receiveapplicationcontext
events.summary: App received app context from apple watch. Will be called on startup if an applicationContext is available.

properties.name: applicationContext
properties.summary: The application Context

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

events.name: receiveuserinfo
events.summary: App received user info from apple watch in background. Will be called on startup if the user info finished transferring when the receiver was not running.

properties.name: userInfo
properties.summary: The user info content

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

events.name: receivefile
events.summary: App received file from apple watch in background.

properties.name: data
properties.summary: The downloaded data as a Titanium.Blob object.

properties.name: metaData
properties.summary: Information about the file.

properties.name: success
properties.summary: If the transfer was successful.

properties.name: errorCode
properties.summary: Error code if transfer failed.

properties.name: message
properties.summary: Error message if any.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

properties.name: isPaired
properties.summary: If the device is paired with the apple watch.

properties.name: isReachable
properties.summary: If apple watch is currently reachable.

properties.name: isWatchAppInstalled
properties.summary: If the watch app is installed in the apple watch.

properties.name: isComplicationEnabled
properties.summary: If the complication is enabled in the apple watch.

properties.name: isActivated
properties.summary:
If the apple watch is currently activated. Only available on iOS 9.3
and later. See <Titanium.WatchSession.isActivated> for more infos.

properties.name: activationState
properties.summary:
Returns the current activation state of the watch.  Only available on iOS 9.3
and later. See <Titanium.WatchSession.activationState> for more infos.

events.summary: Fired when the application completed user info transfer to the watch app.

properties.summary: The downloaded data as a Titanium.Blob object.

events.name: finishfiletransfer
events.summary: App completed file transfer to watch app.

properties.name: fileURL
properties.summary: URL of the file transferred.

properties.name: metaData
properties.summary: meta data of the file transferred.

events.name: inactive
events.summary: Called when the session can no longer be used to modify or add any new transfers and, all interactive messages will be cancelled, but events for background transfers can still fire. This will happen when the selected watch is being changed.

properties.name: isPaired
properties.summary: If the device is paired with the apple watch.

properties.name: isReachable
properties.summary: If apple watch is currently reachable.

properties.name: isWatchAppInstalled

properties.name: isComplicationEnabled

properties.name: isActivated

If the apple watch is currently activated. Only available on iOS 9.3
and later. See <Titanium.WatchSession.isActivated> for more infos.

Returns the current activation state of the watch.  Only available on iOS 9.3
and later. See <Titanium.WatchSession.activationState> for more infos.

events.name: deactivate
events.summary: Called when all events for the previously selected watch has occurred. The session can be re-activated for the now selected watch using activateSession.

properties.name: isPaired
properties.summary: If the device is paired with the apple watch.

properties.name: isReachable
properties.summary: If apple watch is currently reachable.

If the apple watch is currently activated. Only available on iOS 9.3

properties.name: hasContentPending
properties.summary:
If the apple watch has currently content pending. Only available on iOS 10.0
and later. See <Titanium.WatchSession.hasContentPending> for more infos.

properties.name: remainingComplicationUserInfoTransfers
properties.summary:
If the apple watch has complication userInfo transfers left. Only available on iOS 10.0
and later. See <Titanium.WatchSession.remainingComplicationUserInfoTransfers> for more infos.

properties.name: activationState
properties.summary:
Returns the current activation state of the watch.  Only available on iOS 9.3
and later. See <Titanium.WatchSession.activationState> for more infos.

properties.name: source

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

events.name: activationCompleted
events.summary: Called when the session has completed activation. If session state is ACTIVATION_STATE_NOT_ACTIVATED there will be an error with more details.

properties.name: isPaired
properties.summary: If the device is paired with the apple watch.

properties.name: isReachable
properties.summary: If apple watch is currently reachable.

properties.name: isWatchAppInstalled
properties.summary: If the watch app is installed in the apple watch.

properties.name: isComplicationEnabled

properties.summary:
If the apple watch is currently activated. Only available on iOS 9.3
and later. See <Titanium.WatchSession.isActivated> for more infos.

Returns the current activation state of the watch.  Only available on iOS 9.3

methods.name: activateSession
methods.description: Activates the watch session to make the app ready to receive messages from the watch app.

methods.name: cancelAllFileTransfers
methods.summary: Cancels all incomplete file transfers to the apple watch.
methods.description: Cancels all incomplete file transfers to the apple watch.

methods.name: cancelAllTransfers
methods.summary: Cancels all incomplete transfers to the apple watch.
methods.description: Cancels all incomplete transfers to the apple watch, including user info, complication and file.

methods.name: cancelAllUserInfoTransfers
methods.summary: Cancels all incomplete user info and complication transfers to the apple watch.
methods.description: Cancels all incomplete user info and complication transfers to the apple watch.

methods.name: sendMessage
methods.summary: Sends a message to the apple watch.
methods.description: Sends a message to the installed watchapp on the apple watch in the foreground.

parameters.name: message
parameters.summary:
Message to send to apple watch. This property is required and the key of the dictionary 
needs to be a String.

parameters.name: reply
parameters.summary:
Function to be called upon receiving a reply from the watch app.

**Since Release 5.1.0**

This function is used to process the direct reply from the watch app after sending one.

methods.name: transferCurrentComplication
methods.summary: Transfers complication data to the watch application.
methods.description: Transfers complication data to the installed watch app. This is only for watch apps with complications enabled.

parameters.name: params
parameters.summary: Complication to be transferred to watch app.

methods.name: transferFile
methods.summary: Transfers a file to the apple watch.
methods.description: Transfers a file to the installed watchapp on the apple watch in the background. Subsequent transfers are queued.

parameters.name: params
parameters.summary:
Pass an object with the following key-value pairs:

  * `fileURL` (String) (required): Local filesystem path of file to send to the watch app.
  * `metaData` (Dictionary) (optional): Additional information about the file to send to the watch app.

methods.name: transferUserInfo
methods.summary: Transfers an user info to the apple watch.
methods.description: Transfers an user info object to the installed watchapp on the apple watch in the background. Subsequent transfers are queued.

parameters.name: params
parameters.summary: userInfo to be transferred to apple watch.

methods.name: updateApplicationContext
methods.summary: Sends an app context update to the apple watch.
methods.description: Sends an app context update to the apple watch. If watchapp is in background during transfer, watchapp will fire the receiveapplicationcontext event immediately when it becomes active. Only one app context is stored at any one time. Subsequent updates will simply replace the earlier one sent.

parameters.name: params
parameters.summary: App context to be updated in apple watch.

properties.name: activationState
properties.summary: Returns the current activation state of the watch.

properties.name: hasContentPending
properties.summary: Returns true if there is more content for the session to deliver.

properties.name: isActivated
properties.summary: Returns true if the watch is currently activated.

properties.name: isComplicationEnabled
properties.summary: Returns true if complication is enabled on the installed watch app.

properties.name: isPaired
properties.summary: Returns true if the device is paired with a watch.

properties.name: isReachable
properties.summary: Returns true if the watch is currently reachable.

properties.name: isSupported
properties.summary: Returns true if the device supports watch connectivity.

properties.name: isWatchAppInstalled
properties.summary: Returns true if the accompanying watch app is installed.

properties.name: recentApplicationContext
properties.summary: The most recent application context sent to the watch app.

properties.name: remainingComplicationUserInfoTransfers
properties.summary: The number of calls remaining to transferCurrentComplication before the system starts transferring the complicationUserInfo as regular userInfos.
